Responsibilities:  
•	Designed and developed applications and hosted application in WebSphere Servers.  
•	This fast based Agile based project with 2 weeks iterations which includes daily standup and iteration planning, backlog grooming sessions every 2 weeks. 
•	Supported the application in all phases (from design, development, bug fixing and production) 
•	Had an in-depth knowledge of JMS queue (placing and consuming messages from different queue) 
•	These projects have all different frameworks in it from Spring, Structs, EJB and even Opensymphony.  
•	Have an in-depth knowledge SAX & DOM parser, XML and XSLT. 
•	Performing testing using java test case and J-unit.  
•	Involved in moving code from/to TFS, CVS and SVN. 
•	Anthillpro to build and deploy on different environments. 
 
Environment: WebSphere, Tomcat, Anthillpro, XSLT, EJB, Eclipse, J Developer, SVN, CVS, TFS, WireShark, XMLSpy, MQJExplorer, XML, XSLT, Unix, ANT, SQL Developer and Oracle Database. Build and Release Engineer Humana May 2011  –  April 2012  (1 year) Louisville, Kentucky Area ePharmacy (RightSource MailRX): ePharmacy is to java based web-service project in Humana Inc which is used for prescription home-delivery facility offered to Humana members. MailRxWebServices provides an interface to the Humana applications to perform functionalities like Eligibility, Registration and Update Patient etc. The Righsource MailRX web-services are used by the lot of interfaces which includes web portal, IVR, Mobile devices,etc. Righsource MailRX web-services are uses API's supplied by McKesson(Vendor). These web-services are hosted on web-logic servers. By working in this project, I got good domain knowledge of Healthcare and E-Commerce. It helped me in understanding the Middleware technologies in-depth and applying them to the different domain.  
 
Responsibilities:  
•	Designed and developed web services and hosted it in WebLogic Server.  
•	Moving the code to newer version from WebLogic 8.1 to WebLogic 9.2 to support new JDK Version. 
•	Performing testing using java test case, J-unit and SOAP UI testing.  
•	Integrating Mc-kesson/third party API Reengineering the system using SOA to make the system more robust.  
•	Developed new stored procs to meet the requirements.  
•	Have an in-depth knowledge XML, XSLT. 
•	Involved in moving code from/to SVN. 
 
Environment: Web-Logic, XSLT, EJB, Eclipse, SVN, XML, XSLT, Unix, SOA, SOAP, WSDL, UDDI, ANT, Sybase Database. Build Engineer RR Donnelley June 2010  –  May 2011  (1 year) Greater Chicago Area BCS-SOA (Implementation of WSO2 Framework): BCS-SOA is to implementation of WSO2 (Open source) middleware framework in RR Donnelly environment. I had an hand-on experience in all the WSO2 products which includes Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), Business processes Server (BPS), Web Services Application Server (WSAS), Business Rule Server(BRS), Gadget Server(GS), Governance Registry (GREG), Business Activity Monitor (BAM) and Data Services Server (DS). BCS SOA project helped me in developing my Architecting skills and be more familiarizes with various WSO2 products and the strategies which should be followed. 
 
Responsibilities:  
•	Designed and developed Architecture based on WSO2 Framework. WSO2 framework uses Web-services to do all the calls.  
•	Used Maven as a build and deploy mechanism and wrote Maven scripts to accomplish the task.  
•	Designed Use Case, Sequence diagram in UML using Microsoft Visio.  
•	IntelliJ IDEA IDE used for the development purpose.  
•	Used Remote Debugging to debug the application. 
•	Integrating Talend in the workflow. Developed workflow using Business process servers.  
•	Developed rules using Rule server and integrating in the BPS workflow. 
 
Environment: WSO2, Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), Business processes Server (BPS) 
Web Services Application Server (WSAS), Rule Server, Gadget Server, Governance Registry (GREG), Business Activity Monitor (WSO2 BAM), Data Services Server (DS), JDK, Spring, EJB, Eclipse, CVS, XML, Java Script, Windows XP, SOAP, WSDL, UDDI , ANT, Oracle. Java Developer Wright State University/GE Aviation December 2008  –  May 2010  (1 year 6 months) FDM-DO Integration and SAGE Automation: FDM-DO Integration and SAGE Automation is a web based application which is developed to automate the processing engine related request. The primary objective of the FDM-DO Integration and SAGE automation is to automate the basic operations mainly Install Engine, remove engine, on-wing engine configuration update, Spare Engine configuration update, Engine Assert Transfer and Aircraft Assert Transfer.  
 
Responsibilities:  
•	Designed the application based on J2EE Architecture and designed the front-end based on JSP framework and Spring on back-end.  
•	Developed Web-services using Apache AXIS.  
•	Involved in Database design and development (Jboss and Oracle for QA & Prod. environment).  
•	Spring is used for object relational mapping and a persistence management solution.  
•	Used ANT as a build and deploy mechanism for WAS and wrote ANT scripts to accomplish the task.  
•	Used several design patterns like session façade, service locator, business delegate, singleton.  
•	Used JavaScript to perform some preliminary validations and certain client side actions that needed to perform.  
•	Developed necessary DAO’s with Spring as the persistence framework.  
•	Designed Use Case, Sequence diagram in UML using Rational Rose.  
•	Used Jboss server to perform the integration logic such as data mapping and communication with other systems. 
 
Environment: JDK, Spring, Struts, EJB, Hibernate, JBOSS Server, Eclipse, CVS, XML, Java Script, Windows XP, SOAP, WSDL, UDDI , ANT, Oracle 11g. J2EE Programmer US Technology June 2007  –  August 2008  (1 year 3 months) Personnel Management System: The objective of Personnel Management System was to facilitate the Personnel department of the organization for salary calculation, reimbursements & other HR activities. Employees worldwide could enter their time sheets, expense sheets on the net. The system had 3 modules

•	Developing the Use Cases, Class Diagrams and Sequence Diagrams using Rational Rose. Written Server Side programs using Servlets. Used Java Script for client side Validation. 
•	Involved in database design and developed stored procedures and triggers to improve the performance.  
Environment: Java, JavaScript, AWT, Servlets, JDBC, HTML, Front Page, Win NT, Oracle, Apache Tomcat, JBuilder. STE I - III and SDET I Microsoft 1993  –  1995  (2 years) Redmond STE I on Windows 95 Network Drivers team – testing the new Win95 Network Client for backwards compatibility with all network cards in all PC configs. Network adaptors tested for correct identification of Enhanced mode (32-bit and 16-bit) NDIS drive, Real-mode NDIS driver and Real-mode (16-bit) ODI driver. This included having to test Microsoft IPX/SPX protocol which was compatible with Novel Netware Network Client. That worked between Netware Servers/clients and Windows NT 3.5 Networks. Microsoft TCP/IP which only ran in protected mode on windows 95. Microsoft NetBEUI was compatible with existing networks that used NetBIOS like Windows for Workgroups. NDIS 3.1 drivers allowed Windows 95 to support different media including Ethernet, token ring and arc net using plug and play. Tested every possible configuration using these protocols and verifying that they did connect different networks and also the internet.
